name: Zealot

features.Fanatical: Intimidation and Persuasion tests against the zealot gain a disadvantage.
features.Minion: The zealot's attacks can't critically hit, and they're immediately defeated when they suffer an injury.
features.Frenzied: While the zealot is at half health or less, they can't use Brace action, but their movement rate increases by 10 ft and their damage rolls gain an advantage.

action.name: Strike: Longsword
action.description: Attack +4, reach 5 ft., one target. Graze: 4 (1d8) keen damage. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) keen damage.

action.name: Brace
action.description: The zealot raises their shield, and attacks against them gain a disadvantage until the start of the zealot's next turn.

action.name: Inspire Zeal (1 Focus)
action.description: The zealot inspires an ally they can influence within 20ft. That ally can immediately use Strike as a reaction.

tactics: A zealot fights with fanaticism. They and their fellow zealots crowd around enemies and attack recklessly with their Longsword. As a battle grows more violent and their companions become Frenzied, a zealot uses Inspire Zeal to encourage courage and brutality in the face of death.
